text: function takes shapefile creates square hexagon polygon grid based specified grid size

title: Another function to create a gridified shapefile and extract a raster if specified — gengrid2
code: gengrid2(   shp_dt = NULL,   shp_dsn,   shp_layer,   grid_size,   sqr = TRUE,   pop_raster,   raster_path = NULL,   extract_name,   raster_function = "sum" )

title: Another function to create a gridified shapefile and extract a raster if specified — gengrid2
text: shp_dt object class 'sf' 'sfc' shp_dsn character; local directory folder shapefile location. Must specified shp_dt specified. shp_layer character; layer name shapefile. Must specified shp_dsn shp_dt specified grid_size numeric length 1; representing desired size grid meters sqr logical; TRUE, square grid created. FALSE, hexagonal polygon grid created pop_raster raster; object class 'raster' raster_path character; pop_raster specified raster read file. raster_path full name raster (including filepath) extract_name character length 1; name indicator extracted raster raster_function function applied extracting raster created grids

what: This function benchmarks the poverty rates to match survey estimates — saeplus_calibratepovrate

text: function ensures estimated poverty rates obtained aggregating predicted small area estimated matches overall poverty rates obtained general survey

title: This function benchmarks the poverty rates to match survey estimates — saeplus_calibratepovrate
code: saeplus_calibratepovrate(   hh_dt = hh.dt,   pop_dt = gin_masterpoly.dt,   ebp_obj = ginemdi_model2,   area_id = "ADM3_CODE",   pop_var = "population",   harea_id = "ADM1_CODE",   povline = 5006362,   welfare = "pcexp",   weight = "hhweight",   excl_outsample = TRUE )

title: This function benchmarks the poverty rates to match survey estimates — saeplus_calibratepovrate
text: hh_dt household data.frame/data.table object containing area level IDs poverty rates small area estimated pop_dt population level data.frame/data.table object containing geospatial polygons areas level IDs used hh_dt population level estimates can computed ebp_obj object class "emdi" "ebp" obtained small area estimation containing area level poverty rates. Area Level IDs must matching across pop_dt, hh_dt ebp_obj area_id level poverty areas estimated harea_id higher level intermediate SAE estimates computed povline national poverty line used hh_dt object determine survey level poverty rates weight household level weights within hh_dt object excl_outsample whether outsample grids excluded benchmarking exercise

title: Small Estimation of a Sub Area Level Model — saeplus_modelsubarea
code: saeplus_modelsubarea(   hhsurvey_dt,   geopolycensus_dt,   geopoly_id,   size_hh,   geopopvar,   wgt_vartype,   weight,   cons_var,   pline,   cand_vars )

title: Small Estimation of a Sub Area Level Model — saeplus_modelsubarea
text: hhsurvey_dt object class "sf" "data.table/data.frame" representing household unit level data welfare variable geopolycensus_dt object class sf, data.table /data.frame containing polygon/multipolygon geometries geospatial indicators geopoly_id string/character variable representing polygon ID within geopolycensus_dt size_hh integer/numeric household size variable within hhsurvey_dt object geopopvar character string population count variable name geopolycensus_dt wgt_vartype character string representing weighting type hhsurvey_dt. options "hh", "pop" .e. households vs population weights. weight numeric/integer weight variable found within hhsurvey_dt cons_var dependent variable small area estimation (typically household per capita consumption) pline national poverty line (ensure units cons_var) cand_vars character vector candidate explanatory variables included model selection process target_id character string representing integer column vector admin level small area estimates computed poverty map ncpu number CPUs parallelizing small area estimation algorithm

what: Estimate the unit level model — saeplus_modelunitlevel
title: Estimate the unit level model — saeplus_modelunitlevel
text: function prepares remote sensing data imputation checking admin level shapefiles geometric consistency. Prior imputation, algorithm used select appropriate set variables best predicts outcome variable. household survey data used create synthetic census households. empirical best predictor estimated using household survey data used basis imputation synthetic census.

title: Estimate the unit level model — saeplus_modelunitlevel
code: saeplus_modelunitlevel(   hhsurvey_dt,   hhid_var,   size_hh,   adminshp_dt,   target_id,   geopolycensus_dt,   geopopvar,   geopoly_id = "id",   crs_set = rep(4326, 3),   agr_set = rep("constant", 3),   cand_vars,   cons_var,   wgt_vartype = "hh",   weight,   create_dummy = TRUE,   dummy_var,   aggregate_id,   ...,   ncpu = 30,   pline = 5006362,   pline_transform = "inclusion_line",   result_dir = getwd() )

title: Estimate the unit level model — saeplus_modelunitlevel
text: hhsurvey_dt object class data.frame/data.table corresponding household survey data (unit level data) hhid_var household ID variable hhsurvey_dt object size_hh integer/numeric household size variable within hhsurvey_dt object adminshp_dt object class sf, data.table /data.frame containing administrative level boundaries multipolygons/polygons geometries target_id character string representing integer column vector admin level small area estimates computed poverty map geopolycensus_dt object class sf, data.table /data.frame containing polygon/multipolygon geometries geospatial indicators geopopvar character string population count variable name geopolycensus_dt geopoly_id string/character variable representing polygon ID within geopolycensus_dt crs_set integer list coordinate reference systems aforementioned objects .e. CRS hhsurvey_dt, adminshp_dt geopolycensus_dt order agr_set character/string list representing attribute-geometry-relationships specified non-geometry attribute column relates geometry, can one following values "constant", "aggregate" "identity". default constant. See details . AGR listed order crs_set. cand_vars character vector candidate explanatory variables included model selection process cons_var dependent variable small area estimation (typically household per capita consumption) wgt_vartype character string representing weighting type. options "hh", "pop" .e. households vs population weights. weight numeric/integer weight variable create_dummy TRUE, dummy variable created dummy_var specified. Variable must adminshp_dt dummy_var list variables dummies created level. aggregate_id argument NULL, cand_vars aggregated admin level specified aggregate_id argument ... include set arguments available within emdi::ebp() function see fit. ncpu number CPUs parallelizing small area estimation algorithm pline national poverty line pline_transform select order norm transformation method. three options. default inclusion_line" option adds poverty line value stipulated vector welfare vector provided. order norm value obtained normalization process converted value. "interpolation_line" option applies linear interpolation outcome_var estimate conversion "limsup_line" option takes converted value greatest welfare value poverty line result_dir local folder directory tables charts stored. result_dir specified, default result getwd() hhsurvey_lat latitude variable within hh_dt object hhsurvey_lon longitude variable within hh_dt object

title: Compute National Poverty Line — saeplus_ordernormpl
text: function computes poverty line along order norm scale necessary EMDI

title: Compute National Poverty Line — saeplus_ordernormpl
code: saeplus_ordernormpl(   npl_value = 5006362,   pcexp = hh.dt$pcexp,   method = c("inclusion", "interpolation", "limsup") )

title: Compute National Poverty Line — saeplus_ordernormpl
text: npl_value numeric value national/international poverty line coverted order norm scale imputation pcexp numeric vector per capita expenditure values converted undergo order norm normalization method string value indicating method used convert npl currency normalization. Three values selected "inclusion", "interpolation" "limsup

title: Compute National Poverty Line — saeplus_ordernormpl
text: "inclusion" method add poverty line value stipulated vector welfare vector provided. order norm value obtained normalization process converted value interpolation method uses 'pcexp' vector given uses linear interpolation method estimate conversion limsup method takes converted value greatest welfare value poverty line

title: Prepare geospatial data for small area estimation — saeplus_prepdata
text: hhsurvey_dt geocoded household survey data (use st_as_sf() create geometry column available needed hhid_var household ID variable within hhsurvey_dt object adminshp_dt data.frame/data.table/sf object administrative boundaries defined hhgeo_dt sf/data.table/data.frame containing household latitude longitude hhcoords character string length 2 longitude latitude variables (respectively) adminvars list every admin name admin code pair order (e.g c("ADM1_NAME", "ADM1_CODE", "ADM2_NAME", "ADM2_CODE", ...)) geopolycensus_dt object class sf, data.table /data.frame containing polygon/multipolygon geometries geospatial indicators target_id character string representing column vector hhsurvey_dt admin level small area estimates computed poverty map crs_set integer list coordinate reference systems aforementioned objects .e. CRS hh_dt, adminshp_dt geopolycensus_dt order agr_set character/string list representing attribute-geometry-relationships specified non-geometry attribute column relates geometry, can one following values "constant", "aggregate" "identity". default constant. See details . AGR listed order crs_set. drop_chars TRUE, characters (usually country ISO3) admin level names codes dropped. admin level codes must integers emdi::ebp function work.
